meanings.definition: To act together with others in a coordinated manner.
meanings.sent1: The students were coenacting a play for the school assembly.
meanings.sent2: The team was coenacting their plan to win the championship.
meanings.sent3: The animals were coenacting a secret dance routine in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The clouds and the sun seemed to be coenacting a beautiful painting in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized swimmers were coenacting a mesmerizing performance in the pool.

meanings.definition: The act of participating in a joint action or performance.
meanings.sent1: The coenacting of the actors on stage captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: Her coenacting in the charity event helped raise funds for the cause.
meanings.sent3: The coenacting of the clowns at the circus brought laughter to everyone.
meanings.sent4: The coenacting of the musicians created a symphony of sounds.
meanings.sent5: The coenacting of the dancers was a graceful display of unity and harmony.
